ns24:export-package.application-director-version: vFabric Application Director CLI BETA BUILD [5.0.0-809876]

application-versions.name: SQL_Server_2012_Cluster
application-versions.description:
This example contains a clustered node SQL server with a sample application.
Microsoft® SQL Server® 2012 provides a solution for mission-critical applications that require the highest levels of availability. SQL Server 2012 failover clustering is part of the SQL Server high-availability technology toolset and is designed to help businesses meet their availability and uptime goals. This provides protection against both planned as well as unplanned downtime. When a server on one of the node fails SQL Server can continue serving request through other node(s).

application.name: SQL_Server_2012_Cluster
application.description: This application creates a SQL fail-over cluster on the domain. BP contains two services for installation of SQL failover cluster and one SCRIPT component for the demonstration purpose.

service-version.name: Microsoft_SQL_Server2012_Cluster
service-version.description:
Install Microsoft SQL server 2012 failover Cluster. Prerequisites: Failover cluster and iSCSI Server target must be created before executing this script
Microsoft® SQL Server® 2012 provides a solution for mission-critical applications that require the highest levels of availability. SQL Server 2012 failover clustering is part of the SQL Server high-availability technology toolset and is designed to help businesses meet their availability and uptime goals. This provides protection against both planned as well as unplanned downtime. When a server on one of the node fails SQL Server can continue serving request through other node(s).

ns9:component-version-script.script:
###################################################################################################################### # Purpose: 1. This script creates a database $db_name to demonstrate the usage of Sharepoint # # 2. This script creates a table "Persons" in the above database and inserts the values to it # # NOTE: This script is optional. # ###################################################################################################################### # Server name where database $db_name will be created $Server_name="$sql_instanceName\$sql_instanceName"
# DOMAIN DETAILS $domain_account="$domain_name\$domain_username" $domainPASS = convertto-securestring "$domain_password" -asplaintext –force $domainCredential = New-Object -TypeName System.Management.Automation.PSCredential -ArgumentList "$domain_name\$domain_username",$domainPASS
$MainNode=[System.Net.Dns]::GetHostName() if($nodes_hostname[0] -eq $MainNode) { # Create an object for sql client connection add-content "C:\Sample_App.ps1" '$conn = New-Object System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection' # setting the connection parametrers to the created connection object add-content "C:\Sample_App.ps1" "`$conn.ConnectionString = `"Server=$Server_name`;Integrated Security=True`;`"" # Open the SQL connection add-content "C:\Sample_App.ps1" '$conn.Open()' # SQL statement to create database add-content "C:\Sample_App.ps1" "`$sql = `"CREATE DATABASE $db_name`"" # Create an object for sql client command # pass the sql statement and sql connection object to the sql command object add-content "C:\Sample_App.ps1" '$cmd = New-Object System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand($sql,$conn)' # execute the sql command add-content "C:\Sample_App.ps1" '$cmd.ExecuteNonQuery()' # close the sql connection add-content "C:\Sample_App.ps1" '$conn.close()' # Create an object for sql client connection add-content "C:\Sample_App.ps1" '$conn = New-Object System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection' # setting the connection parametrers to the created connection object add-content "C:\Sample_App.ps1" "`$conn.ConnectionString = `"Server=$Server_name`;Integrated Security=True`;Database=$db_name`;`"" # Open the SQL connection add-content "C:\Sample_App.ps1" '$conn.Open()' # SQL statement to create a table "Persons" having 3 columns P_Id,Name and Age. add-content "C:\Sample_App.ps1" '$sql = "CREATE TABLE Persons' add-content "C:\Sample_App.ps1" '(' add-content "C:\Sample_App.ps1" 'P_Id int,' add-content "C:\Sample_App.ps1" 'Name varchar(255),' add-content "C:\Sample_App.ps1" 'Age int' add-content "C:\Sample_App.ps1" ')"' # Create an object for sql client command # pass the sql statement and sql connection object to the sql command object add-content "C:\Sample_App.ps1" '$cmd = New-Object System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand($sql,$conn)' # execute the sql command add-content "C:\Sample_App.ps1" '$cmd.ExecuteNonQuery()' # SQL statement to insert values into the table "Persons" add-content "C:\Sample_App.ps1" '$sql ="INSERT INTO Persons VALUES (4,''Rick'', 23)"' # pass the sql statement and sql connection object to the sql command object add-content "C:\Sample_App.ps1" '$cmd = New-Object System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand($sql,$conn)' # execute the sql command add-content "C:\Sample_App.ps1" '$cmd.ExecuteNonQuery()'
# Database can be created only under domain user account. So Create a schedule task for it and run the task schtasks /CREATE /TN "SQL_SampleApp" /SC MONTHLY /MO first /D SUN /RL HIGHEST /RU $domain_account /RP $domain_password /TR "powershell -noprofile -command &{C:\Sample_App.ps1} -WindowStyle Hidden" /F schtasks /RUN /TN "SQL_SampleApp" } $LASTEXITCODE=0

application-version.name: SQL_Server_2012_Cluster
application-version.description:
This example contains a clustered node SQL server with a sample application.
Microsoft® SQL Server® 2012 provides a solution for mission-critical applications that require the highest levels of availability. SQL Server 2012 failover clustering is part of the SQL Server high-availability technology toolset and is designed to help businesses meet their availability and uptime goals. This provides protection against both planned as well as unplanned downtime. When a server on one of the node fails SQL Server can continue serving request through other node(s).

This provides protection against both planned as well as unplanned downtime. When a server on one of the node fails SQL Server can continue serving request through other node(s).

ns9:component-version-script.script:
###################################################################################################################### # Purpose: 1. This script creates a database $db_name to demonstrate the usage of Sharepoint # # 2. This script creates a table "Persons" in the above database and inserts the values to it # # NOTE: This script is optional. # ###################################################################################################################### # Server name where database $db_name will be created $Server_name="$sql_instanceName\$sql_instanceName"
# DOMAIN DETAILS $domain_account="$domain_name\$domain_username" $domainPASS = convertto-securestring "$domain_password" -asplaintext –force $domainCredential = New-Object -TypeName System.Management.Automation.PSCredential -ArgumentList "$domain_name\$domain_username",$domainPASS
$MainNode=[System.Net.Dns]::GetHostName() if($nodes_hostname[0] -eq $MainNode) { # Create an object for sql client connection add-content "C:\Sample_App.ps1" '$conn = New-Object System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection' # setting the connection parametrers to the created connection object add-content "C:\Sample_App.ps1" "`$conn.ConnectionString = `"Server=$Server_name`;Integrated Security=True`;`"" # Open the SQL connection add-content "C:\Sample_App.ps1" '$conn.Open()' # SQL statement to create database add-content "C:\Sample_App.ps1" "`$sql = `"CREATE DATABASE $db_name`"" # Create an object for sql client command # pass the sql statement and sql connection object to the sql command object add-content "C:\Sample_App.ps1" '$cmd = New-Object System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand($sql,$conn)' # execute the sql command add-content "C:\Sample_App.ps1" '$cmd.ExecuteNonQuery()' # close the sql connection add-content "C:\Sample_App.ps1" '$conn.close()' # Create an object for sql client connection add-content "C:\Sample_App.ps1" '$conn = New-Object System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection' # setting the connection parametrers to the created connection object add-content "C:\Sample_App.ps1" "`$conn.ConnectionString = `"Server=$Server_name`;Integrated Security=True`;Database=$db_name`;`"" # Open the SQL connection add-content "C:\Sample_App.ps1" '$conn.Open()' # SQL statement to create a table "Persons" having 3 columns P_Id,Name and Age. add-content "C:\Sample_App.ps1" '$sql = "CREATE TABLE Persons' add-content "C:\Sample_App.ps1" '(' add-content "C:\Sample_App.ps1" 'P_Id int,' add-content "C:\Sample_App.ps1" 'Name varchar(255),' add-content "C:\Sample_App.ps1" 'Age int' add-content "C:\Sample_App.ps1" ')"' # Create an object for sql client command # pass the sql statement and sql connection object to the sql command object add-content "C:\Sample_App.ps1" '$cmd = New-Object System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand($sql,$conn)' # execute the sql command add-content "C:\Sample_App.ps1" '$cmd.ExecuteNonQuery()' # SQL statement to insert values into the table "Persons" add-content "C:\Sample_App.ps1" '$sql ="INSERT INTO Persons VALUES (4,''Rick'', 23)"' # pass the sql statement and sql connection object to the sql command object add-content "C:\Sample_App.ps1" '$cmd = New-Object System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand($sql,$conn)' # execute the sql command add-content "C:\Sample_App.ps1" '$cmd.ExecuteNonQuery()'
# Database can be created only under domain user account. So Create a schedule task for it and run the task schtasks /CREATE /TN "SQL_SampleApp" /SC MONTHLY /MO first /D SUN /RL HIGHEST /RU $domain_account /RP $domain_password /TR "powershell -noprofile -command &{C:\Sample_App.ps1} -WindowStyle Hidden" /F schtasks /RUN /TN "SQL_SampleApp" } $LASTEXITCODE=0

task.description: A script to Join Domain, add dns server and Disable Firewall
task.content: echo "DISABLE FIREWALL" netsh advfirewall set allprofiles state off echo "ADDING NODE TO DOMAIN" $DOMAINJOIN=[System.Net.Dns]::GetHostName() netsh interface ipv4 set dns name="Local Area Connection" source=static address="$domain_ip" primary netdom join "$DOMAINJOIN" /domain:$domain_name /userd:$dmoain_user /passwordd:$domain_password Set-ExecutionPolicy remotesigned -force
